chapter.p: 1The word of Yahweh that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations. 2Concerning Egypt: Concerning the army of Pharaoh Neco, the king of Egypt, which was by the Euphrates River at Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, the king of Judah.

ul.li1: 3“Prepare small shield and shield,
ul.li2: and approach for the battle!
ul.li1: 4Harness the horses and mount the steeds!
ul.li2: And take your stand with helmets!
ul.li1: Polish the spears!
ul.li2: Put on the body armor!
ul.li1: 5Why do I see them terrified?
ul.li2: They are turning back
ul.li1: and their warriors are beaten down.
ul.li2: And they have fled to a place of refuge
ul.li1: and they do not turn back.
ul.li2: Terror is from all around,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 6The swift cannot flee,
ul.li2: and the warrior cannot escape.
ul.li1: They have stumbled and they have fallen,
ul.li2: by the bank of the Euphrates River.
ul.li1: 7Who is this that rises like the Nile,
ul.li2: like the rivers whose waters surge?
ul.li1: 8Egypt rises like the Nile,
ul.li2: even like the rivers whose waters surge.
ul.li1: And he says, “Let me rise,
ul.li2: let me cover the earth,
ul.li1: let me destroy cities,
ul.li2: and the inhabitants in them.”
ul.li1: 9Go up, O horses,
ul.li2: and drive madly, O chariots,Hebrew “chariot”
ul.li1: and let the warriors go forth;
ul.li2: Cush and Put, who wield the small shield,
and Lud, who wield and bend the bow.
ul.li1: 10For that day is to the Lord Yahweh of hosts
ul.li2: a day of retribution,
to take revenge on his foes.
ul.li1: And the sword will devour and be satisfied,
ul.li2: and it will drink its fill of their blood,
ul.li1: for a sacrifice is for the Lord Yahweh of hosts
ul.li2: in the land of the north by the Euphrates River.
ul.li1: 11Go up to Gilead and take balm,
ul.li2: O virgin of the daughter of Egypt.
ul.li1: In vainLiterally “To the vanity” you make use of many medicines;
ul.li2: there is no healing for you.
ul.li1: 12The nations have heard your shame,
ul.li2: and your cry of lament fills the earth.
ul.li1: For warrior has stumbled against warrior,
ul.li2: together they have fallen, the two of them.

chapter.p: 13The word that Yahweh spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon to attack the land of Egypt:

ul.li1: 14“Declare in Egypt, and proclaim in Migdol,
ul.li2: and proclaim in Memphis and in Tahpanhes,
ul.li1: say, ‘Take your stand and be prepared,
ul.li2: for the sword will devour those all around you.’
ul.li1: 15Why are your bulls defeated?
ul.li2: He did not stand because Yahweh thrust him down.
ul.li1: 16He multiplied the onesHebrew “one” stumbling.
ul.li2: Furthermore, each one fell to his neighbor,
ul.li1: and said, ‘Stand up, and let us return to our people
ul.li2: and to the land of our birth,
because ofLiterally “from” the presenceLiterally “face” of the sword of the oppressor.’
ul.li1: 17They will call there,
‘Pharaoh, the king of Egypt is but a roar,
ul.li2: he missed the opportunity.’Literally “he has allowed to pass over the appointed time”
ul.li1: 18As I live,”Literally “Life I” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” the king,
ul.li2: Yahweh of hosts is his name,
ul.li1: “one will come like Tabor among the mountains
ul.li2: and like Carmel by the sea.
ul.li1: 19Pack your baggage for exile,
ul.li2: O inhabitantsHebrew “inhabitant” of the daughter of Egypt,
ul.li1: for Memphis will become as a horror,
ul.li2: and it will be destroyed, withoutLiterally “from there is not” inhabitant.
ul.li1: 20Egypt is a beautiful heifer,
ul.li2: but a gadfly from the north will come against her.
ul.li1: 21Even her mercenaries in her midst are like calves of fattening,
ul.li2: for they also have turned away,
they have fled together.
ul.li1: They stand not,
ul.li2: for the day of their calamity has come,
the time of their punishment.
ul.li1: 22Her sound is like a snake that glides away,
ul.li2: for they march in force.
ul.li1: And with axes they come to her
ul.li2: like those who chop trees.
ul.li1: 23They will cut down her forest,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “for it is impenetrable.Literally “it cannot be searched out”
ul.li1: Yes, they are more numerous than locusts,Hebrew “locust”
ul.li2: and they are without number.Literally “there is not to them a number”
ul.li1: 24The daughter of Egypt will be ashamed,
ul.li2: she will be given into the hand of the people of the north.”

chapter.p: 25Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel, said, “Look, I am going to punish Amon of Thebes, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, and her gods, and her kings, even Pharaoh and those who trust in him. 26And I will give them into the hand of the seekers of their lives,Hebrew “life” and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and into the hand of his troops. But afterwardLiterally “after thus” it will be inhabited, as in days of old,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.

ul.li1: 27“But as for you, my servant Jacob, you must not be afraid,
ul.li2: and Israel, you must not be dismayed,
ul.li1: for look, I am going to save you from far,
ul.li2: and your offspring from the land of their captivity.
ul.li1: And Jacob will return,
ul.li2: and he will be quiet,
ul.li1: and he will be at ease,
ul.li2: and without one who makes him afraid.
ul.li1: 28You must not be afraid, my servant Jacob,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “for I am with you.
ul.li1: For I will make a complete destruction in all the nations where I scattered you,
ul.li2: but you I will not make a complete destruction,
ul.li1: though I will chastise you to the measure,
ul.li2: and I will certainly not leave you unpunished.”
